definition:
A [*telescoping sum*]{} is a sum in which cancellation occurs between
subsequent terms, allowing the sum to be expressed using only the
initial and final terms.

Formally a telescoping sum is or can be rewritten in the form

$$S= \sum_{n=\alpha}^{\beta}\left(a_n - a_{n+1}\right) = a_\alpha - a_{\beta+1}$$

where $a_n$ is a sequence.

[**Example:**]{}\
Define $S(N) = \sum_{n=1}^{N} \frac{1}{n(n+1)}$. Note that by partial
fractions of expressions:
$$\frac{1}{n(n+1)}= \frac{1}{n} - \frac{1}{n+1}$$ and thus
$a_n = \frac{1}{n}$ in this example.

$$S(N) = \sum_{n=1}^{N} \left( \frac{1}{n} - \frac{1}{n+1} \right)$$
$$= \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2} \right)
      + \cdots + \left( \frac{1}{n} - \frac{1}{n+1} \right) +
      \left( \frac{1}{n+1} - \frac{1}{n+2} \right)
      + \cdots + \left( \frac{1}{N} - \frac{1}{N+1} \right)$$
$$= 1 + \left( - \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} \right)
      + \cdots + \left( -\frac{1}{n+1} +\frac{1}{n+1} \right)
      + \cdots - \frac{1}{N+1}$$ $$= 1 - \frac{1}{N+1}$$
